meaning: n./v. 冰雹/赞扬；招呼；下冰雹
example: It hailed during the night

meaning: v./n. 解冻；融解；融化/解冻时期
example: The sun thawed the ice and melted the snow

meaning: v./n. 使变冷；使恐惧/寒冷；害怕
example: The bad news cast a chill over the whole family
The weatherman predicted a freeze for tonight
Hohhot is a frigid city in winter
There was a tremble in her voice
She shivered because she was worried and afraid

meaning: n./v. 雷；雷声/打雷；轰隆隆的快速移动
example: An express train thundered through the station

meaning: n./v. 闪电/闪电般的，极快的
example: During the storm, flashes of lightning appeared in the sky

meaning: adj. 有暴风雨的；争吵激烈的；（大海）波涛汹涌的
example: Our ship was tossed about on the stormy sea
For the past six hours, the downpour had been continuous
There have been four years of below-average rainfall

meaning: v./n. 撒；下小雨/少量；小雨
example: We've only had a few sprinkles of rain recently
A rainbow is usually seen after a heavy rain
The weatherman predicts showers this afternoon
The maximum temperature in July may be 36 degrees Celsius
After the storm, there will be a sharp drop in temperature

meaning: n./v. 预测；预报/预测；预言
example: The recent statement of the president forecasts a change in the situation

meaning: n./v. 山峰；顶点；达到最大值
example: The mountain peaks are covered with snow all year around

meaning: v./n. 渐渐增加；爬上；登上/山
example: The old lady can only mount the stairs with difficulty
The northern side of the mountain is almost vertical
A range of hills rose on our left
The sky above the ridges of the mountains brightened

meaning: v./n. 倾斜；有坡度；山坡；斜坡
example: He ran up the slope to the top of the hill
The valley was hidden from view in the mist
The path steepened as they climed the hillside

meaning: v. 远眺；俯瞰；未注意到
example: The house on the hill overlooks the village
Only in the southern part of Taiwan have I seen such scenery
Austria lies to the southeast of Germany
Ireland is in the southwest of the British Isles
Snow in October is nothing strange in northeast China
There is a large hilly area in the northwest
The eastern situation is similarly intense

meaning: adj. 东方的（尤其指中日）
example: She has studied the cultures of oriental countries

meaning: adj. 必然的；不可避免的
example: Such a difficult operation may not succeed, but it's an inevitable gamble

meaning: adj. 不可逆转的；不可挽回的
example: He suffered irreversible brain damage in the incident

meaning: adv. 不规则地；不合常规地
example: The patient is breathing irregularly
Your bright red coat would be quite inappropriate for a funeral

meaning: adj. 不正常的；反常的；变态的
example: El Nino will result in the abnormal weather
The sediment of coffee will settle
River sediments gradually silted up the harbor
We left the car and struck out along the muddy track
Bricks and dishes are made from various kinds of clay
The children were outside, playing happily in the dirt

meaning: adj. 农村的；乡村的；田园的
example: The disease occurs most frequently in rural areas
They proposed setting up a school in the suburbs
We live on the outskirts of the city

meaning: adj. 遥远的；偏僻的；疏远的
example: She came from a remote village
So how should they escape from these desolate canyons?
It snows all year around in that distant little village
We stayed in adjacent rooms
All medicines are toxic
Wastewater from the factory is the main cause of pollution in local rivers
Coal is a heavy pollutant
The river was contaminated with waste
He devoted all his life to the research of agricultural geology

meaning: n./v. 边界；边界地区；镶边；和...毗邻；形成...边界
example: The border incident led to the war between the two countries

meaning: n. 边缘；页边空白；余地
example: There is no margin for error in our plan

meaning: n./adj. 边缘；刘海/非主要的；次要的；边缘的，附加的
example: We feel it's pretty good and we also offer some good fringe benefits
It is generally accepted that earthquakes are caused by two tectonic plates bumping into each other
